BR_text.BRsummary: node_type_subgraph fails when a graph does not have edges on the node type
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h2>🐛 Bug</denchmark-h>
 
 As reported in <denchmark-link:https://discuss.dgl.ai/t/is-globalattentionpooling-supposed-to-work-with-heterographs/1642>discussion thread 1642</denchmark-link>
 , currently  fails when a graph does not have edges among nodes of the type.
 A straightforward fix is to return a graph with no edges in the case.
 <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 import dgl
 
 g = dgl.heterograph({('a', 'a2b', 'b'): ([0, 1, 2], [0, 1, 0])})
 g.node_type_subgraph('a')
 <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
 
 Return a graph with 3 nodes and 0 edges.

comments_0.comment_text: One issue is that DGL does not allow heterogeneous graphs without relations.
